txt.en: 'I understand my son's anger and his search for vengeance, as his beloved was a sorry victim of her family's actions.'
'I will face you now, but I will also warn you that I will present you with other challenges along the way.'
Instance:  Father of Our Lament
Defeated Fernvael
'TBD Your kindness has made it so that my people will find rest from this torment. \n\n'I cannot express my gratitude.  Travel safetly, I will show you the way.'
Find Fernvael's resting place and present the shade with the amulet you remade.
TBD
'My son has sent forth a worthy opponent. As I rest a moment, face some of my men.'
'A suitable display of skill...I shall enjoy this.'
'A challenge indeed...perhaps you should meet a few more of my men.'
'It is a shame to lose such good men, but at least you are a worthy adversary.'
Find and confront Fernvael
'You have defeated me. I call forth my son to come before me. Let it be known that his champion has defeated me.'
Find and open the crypt of Fernvael
Speak to TBD Son.
Within the depths of Crug Fernvael lies the restless spirit of Fernvael father of Cadelhin, who brought the curse of the Wild Huntsman down upon them.
'Son, your champion has defeated me.'
'Father, after all of these years, you have finally paid for what you did to my beloved.'
'Son, what you never understood was that I mourned the loss of your beloved, but her people were going to betray us.'
'They planned to attack just before your wedding. I could not allow my people to be slaughtered like goats.'
'But why her? Why did you have to hurt her? She had nothing to do with it.'
'She was an unfortunate victim, as I said. However, I am unsure how our people are cursed to this eternal torment.'
'The curse levied upon your people was twofold. The first was due to the destruction of my gift: the amulet that was cleft in twain.'
'The second was the breaking of the tradition of hospitality, an oath sworn in earnest. While these men may have betrayed you, they were still guests in your hall.'
'So a curse was placed upon your people. This day, with the defeat of the transgressor, Cadelhin, your followers will go free.'
'Fernvael, your people will remain for ten passings of the seasons. Cadelhin, your people will fade within the next passing of the seasons.'
'I see that my son has chosen a champion. It is good that he has chosen such an accomplished [placeholder].'
'He is somewhat mistaken. I mourn for the loss of his wife, but not for what preceded it.'
'I intercepted a message saying that his beloved's family would strike against us before the ceremony, I could not allow that.'
'[placeholder], thank you for your assistance, please allow me to lead you from this place. Your service will not be forgotten.'
